intro: Sisymbrium gariepinum, commonly known as the African peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, exhibiting a low-growing, herbaceous habit. Its small white or yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium gariepinum is adapted to arid conditions and can thrive in poor soil environments.
